lead_paragraph: RAMOND--Mary Minter Patterson, of New York City, NY, died on Wednesday, January 20, 2016 at her home. She was born on April 9, 1933 in Rocky Mount, VA. She graduated from Hollins College in Roanoke, VA, and attended Universidad Nacional Autonoma de Mexico in Mexico City, Mexico and Universidad Nacional de San Marcos in Lima, Peru. She is survived by her son, Nicholas, Nicholas' wife, Nandini and her grandson, Jackson of Salt Lake City, UT; her sister, Alice Newbill of Wirtz, VA and brother, Dr. Abram Patterson of Roanoke, VA. She was predeceased by her husband, Dr. Charles. K. Ramond. Mary made a career writing about and promoting business in the Caribbean and Central America, first with her monthly newsletter, Caribbean Report, and later in a number of publications, including Forbes magazine, through her business, Caribbean Business Development. But, what Mary really did was live life to the fullest. She took on every challenge and enjoyed each moment whether it was canoeing down the Amazon, running out of fuel while flying over Mexico or just playing her weekly tennis match. She will be missed by all those who knew her. 1/3
